channel.title: What's an easy way to get a schedule change?
channel.description: Well damn. I got my schedule today, and just compared it to my two best friends, and found out we have NO classes together. The class I wanted to take [and have taken lower versions of it for the past 4 years] started doing background checks this year due to "trouble makers" and due to my "history" [none of which happened in the particular class] i wasn't allowed in. Because of that I either could take an art class or a computer class, computers being one of my skills, I took that. The scheduler told me that advanced classes would be at a different block so I would have to have a schedule change if I got into those [with permission from the computer guy]. I'm trying that and HOPING that I can at least get in 1 class with my friends, preferably as many as possible :) Anyways, does anyone have any ideas on how to get a schedule change without like hacking the school or something? I've gotten into enough trouble already and don't want to go down that road.

item.title: What's an easy way to get a schedule change?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Casey.:

Well surely you’ll see them on lunch break, right?

Not certain, they have multiple lunches :
School counselor?
No idea who that is I’ll maybe try and find out if I can

Read full topic
item.source: What's an easy way to get a schedule change?

item.title: What's an easy way to get a schedule change?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Maybe say theres a student in that class who you have problems with, and you don’t want to cause any trouble, you just want to stay laid back, and want to go to the class your friend is in?

Read full topic

item.title: What's an easy way to get a schedule change?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Make new friends, or speak to who ever is in charge with this at your school?

All schools are different. I don’t know how we can help.

Read full topic
